page.title: 14FARMING, BARNHORN FARM
page.content: BARNHORN FARM IS ALSO KNOWN SOMESTIMES AS BARNHORN MANOR FARM,THE RESPECTIVE OWNERS DISPUTING THE TITLE.THIS ALSO CLAIMS A CHARTER FROM KING OFFA.AT THE TIME OF THE DISSOLUTION OF THE MONASTERIES IT BELONGED TO BATTLE ABBEY,AND RUMOUR HAS IT THAT THE ABBEY TREASURE WAS BROUGHT HERE BY MONKS AND BURIED FOR SAFE-KEEPING.BUT THE GOLD- PLATE WAS NEVER RECOVERED.ITS 4 ACRES ARE PASTURE FOR HORSES,THOUGH FEWER ARE KEPT HERE NOW THAN IN THE PAST. SOME OF THE RACE-HORSES STABLED HERE WERE QUITE FAMOUS:COO SPIRIT,EMMA AND THE DOLPHIN FOR EXAMPLE.THE OWNER,MRS RADCLIFFE,ALSO BREEDS BOARDER TERRIERS AND HAS BANTAMS AND GUINEA FOWL.AT THE REAR IS AN OLD TWO-STORIED SHEPHERD'S LOOKOUT MADE OF ROUGH FLINT,WITH WOODEN STEPS ON THE OUTSIDE TO THE TOP FLOOR FROM WHERE THE SHEPHERD COULD WATCH THE MARSH.UNDERNEATH IS A STORE.
